alert.note: Alert for Alamosa Vicinity, Central San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Central Chaffee County Below 9000 Ft; Del Norte Vicinity, Northern San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Saguache County West of Continental Divide Below 10000 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 2:09PM MST until February 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS BEEN ISSUED FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Colorado. * WHEN...From 5 PM Monday to 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow will be along the west- facing slopes of the higher terrain, both over the lower elevations of Chaffee County and the west-facing slopes of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains in the San Luis Valley, which could see localized snowfall amounts exceeding 12 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
